translation:
Clinical Question: Sinusitis?

Technique: CT scan of the paranasal sinuses.

Findings: The paranasal sinuses are largely aerated. There is a mild mucosal swelling in the right maxillary sinus. The other paranasal sinuses appear unremarkable.

Conclusion: Mild right maxillary sinusitis.

report_to_rate:
Fragestellung: Schilddrüsendiagnostik, Knotenabklärung  
Technik: Sonographie Schilddrüse mit hochauflösendem Linearschallkopf.  
Befund: Die Schilddrüse zeigt ein normales Volumen und eine homogene, echoarme Parenchymstruktur. Im rechten Lappen findet sich ein solider Knoten mit einem Durchmesser von 15 mm. Der Knoten ist echoarm, scharf begrenzt und weist eine haloartige Begrenzung auf. Keine Mikrokalzifikationen. Die Durchblutung des Knotens ist im Farbdoppler unauffällig. Im linken Lappen zeigen sich zwei weitere kleine, zystische Knoten mit einem Durchmesser von jeweils ca. 4 mm. Die Trachea ist mittig gelegen und nicht verdrängt. Keine vergrößerten Lymphknoten im Halsbereich.  
Beurteilung: Kein solider Schilddrüsenknoten rechts mit sonographisch benignen Charakteristika (TIRADS 2). Zwei kleine zystische Knoten links ohne malignitätsverdächtige Merkmale. Eine weitere Abklärung des rechtsseitigen Knotens mittels Feinnadelpunktion wird empfohlen.

translation:
Inquiry: Thyroid diagnostics, nodule evaluation  
Technique: Thyroid ultrasound using a high-resolution linear transducer.  
Findings: The thyroid gland exhibits normal volume and a homogeneous, hypoechoic parenchymal structure. In the right lobe, there is a solid nodule measuring 15 mm in diameter. The nodule is hypoechoic, well-defined, and has a halo-like border. No microcalcifications are present. The nodule's blood flow appears normal on color Doppler. In the left lobe, there are two additional small cystic nodules, each approximately 4 mm in diameter. The trachea is centrally located and not displaced. No enlarged lymph nodes are observed in the neck region.  
Assessment: Solid thyroid nodule on the right with sonographically benign characteristics (TIRADS 2). Two small cystic nodules on the left without suspicious features for malignancy. Further evaluation of the right-sided nodule via fine-needle aspiration is recommended.

report_to_rate:
Befund:

Unauffällige Darstellung der basalen Halsabschnitte. Lungenparenchym allseits der Thoraxwand anliegend. Rechtsführend zeigen sich bronchovaskulär assoziierte Milchglastrübungen. Subpleurale zystische Veränderungen dorsobasal. Diskrete fissurale Verdickung sowie verdickte Lappen- sowie Segmentbronchien rechtsseitig. 
Kein Nachweis pathologisch vergrößerter Lymphknoten mediastinal, hilär oder axillär. Zustand nach Dreigefäß-Stenting koronar. Aorten- und Mitralklappenkalk. Kein Nachweis einer Kontrastmittelaussparung der Pulmonalarterien. Keine CT-morphologischen Rechtsherzbelastungszeichen. Unauffällige Darstellung der erfassten Abdominalorgane. Schwerste degenerative Veränderungen der Wirbelsäule.

Beurteilung:
-Kein Nachweis einer Lungenarterienembolie. Keine CT-morphologischen Rechtsherzbelastungszeichen.
-Fokal-milchglasartige Verdichtungen im linken Lungenflügel, bei entsprechender Klinik gut passend zu atypischen Infiltraten.

translation:
Findings:

The lower neck regions appear unremarkable. The lung parenchyma is adjacent to the thoracic wall on all sides. On the right side, there are ground-glass opacities associated with bronchovascular structures. Subpleural cystic changes are noted dorsobasally. There is subtle fissural thickening and thickened lobar and segmental bronchi on the right side. 
No evidence of pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinal, hilar, or axillary regions. Status post triple-vessel coronary stenting. Calcification of the aortic and mitral valves. No evidence of contrast filling defects in the pulmonary arteries. No CT morphological signs of right heart strain. The abdominal organs included in the scan appear unremarkable. Severe degenerative changes in the spine.

Impression:
-No evidence of pulmonary artery embolism. No CT morphological signs of right heart strain.
-Focal ground-glass opacities in the right lung, which, in the appropriate clinical context, are consistent with atypical infiltrates.

Ovaire droite de taille et de morphologie normales.
Ovaire gauche non vu.

Lame d'épanchement pelvien.
Appendice non vu.
Ovaire gauche de taille et de morpholgie normales.
Ovaire droite non vu.

translation:
Abdominal and Pelvic Ultrasound

Reason for Exam:
Sudden, intense abdominal pain for the past 3 days.

Findings:
- The liver is normal in size, with smooth edges and a uniform internal structure. No focal lesions were detected within the liver. The hepatic veins and portal vein are well open.
- The gallbladder is normal in size, with thin walls and contains no stones. There is no dilation of the bile ducts inside or outside the liver.
- The pancreas is visible in its head and body regions, with a uniform internal structure.
- The spleen is normal in size and has a uniform internal structure.
- The kidneys are symmetrical and normal in size, with good differentiation between the parenchyma and sinus. There is no dilation of the renal pelvis or calyces, and no masses or stones were detected.
- The bladder is partially filled and contains clear fluid.
- There is a small amount of fluid in the pelvic area.
- The appendix was not visible. No pain was noted when the probe was moved over the area.
- The right ovary is normal in size and shape.
- The left ovary was not visible.

Conclusion:
- Small amount of fluid in the pelvic area.
- Appendix not visible.
- Right ovary is normal in size and shape.
- Left ovary not visible.

report_to_rate:
Échographie thyroïdienne

Indication :
Hyperthyroïdie et douleurs cervicales dans un contexte d'infection virale.

Résultats :

Isthme mesurant 2 mm.
Lobe droit mesurant 51 x 22 x 20 mm soit environ 11 cc.
Lobe gauche mesurant 48 x 19 x 17 mm soit environ 8 cc.

Plage hypoéchogène pseudonodulaire aux contours mal limités de 32 x 18 mm pour 25 mm de hauteur dans le tiers moyen du lobe droit, faiblement vascularisées au Doppler.
Par ailleurs, contours réguliers et échostructure homogène hyperéchogène.

Pas d'anomalie du tractus thyréoglosse.
Pas d'adénopathie dans les secteurs II, III, IV et VI.
Perméabilité des vaisseaux jugulo-carotidiens.

Conclusion :
Plage hypoéchogène pseudonodulaire de 3 x 2,5 cm dans le tiers moyen du lobe droit en faveur d'une thyroïdite de De Quervain dans le contexte. Intérêt d'un contrôle échographique dans trois mois pour ne pas méconnaître une lésion évolutive.

translation:
Thyroid Ultrasound

Indication:
Hyperthyroidism and neck pain in the context of a viral infection.

Findings:

Isthmus measuring 2 mm.
Right lobe measuring 51 x 22 x 20 mm, approximately 11 cc.
Left lobe measuring 48 x 19 x 17 mm, approximately 8 cc.

Hypoechoic pseudonodular area with poorly defined borders measuring 32 x 18 mm and 25 mm in height in the mid-third of the right lobe, with low vascularity on Doppler.
Otherwise, regular contours and homogeneous hyperechoic echotexture.

No abnormalities of the thyroglossal tract.
No lymphadenopathy in regions II, III, IV, and VI.
Jugular-carotid vessels are patent.

Conclusion:
Hypoechoic pseudonodular area of 3 x 2.5 cm in the mid-third of the right lobe suggestive of De Quervain's thyroiditis in this context. Follow-up ultrasound in three months is recommended to monitor for any evolving lesions.

report_to_rate:
---
Descripción y hallazgos  
Fosa posterior:  
-Cerebelo: Se observa LOE intraparenquimatosa en el hemisferio cerebeloso derecho. La lesión es heterogénea, predominantemente hipointensa en Flair y T1, con intenso realce en la serie post-gadolinio. Presenta algunas pequeñas áreas pseudoquísticas hiperintensas en T2 y Flair e hipointensas en T1 sin realce.  
Mide aproximadamente 38 x 25 mm de diámetro mayor en el plano axial por 36 mm en sentido anteroposterior y 27 mm de altura.  
La lesión se encuentra rodeada de edema vasogénico perilesional hiperintenso en T2 y Flair. La lesión ejerce discreto efecto de masa sobre el cuarto ventrículo y provoca ligero desplazamiento caudal de la amígdala cerebelosa derecha en el foramen magno.  
Se observan dos pequeños focos de realce nodulares a nivel posterobasal derecho de 5 mm y cerebeloso anterosuperior derecho de 4 mm.  
El resto del cerebelo no muestra alteraciones significativas.  
-Tronco cerebral: Sin particularidades  
Línea media: Sin particularidades  
Sistema ventricular supratentorial: Forma y tamaño habitual  
Surcos corticales y cisternas: Conservados  
Parénquima cerebral: De morfología e intensidad de señal conservada en sustancia gris y blanca  
En la serie post-gadolinio no se observan otros realces patológicos parenquimatosos ni meníngeos. Comentario imagenológico:  
LOE intraparenquimatosa cerebelosa derecha de aspecto heterogéneo, con intenso realce postcontraste y rodeada de edema vasogénico perilesional. Ejerce discreto efecto de masa sobre el cuarto ventrículo y desplazamiento caudal de la amígdala cerebelosa derecha. No se observan pequeños nódulos de realce satélites en hemisferio cerebeloso derecho.
---

translation:
Description and Findings

Posterior Fossa:
- Cerebellum: There is an intraparenchymal space-occupying lesion in the right cerebellar hemisphere. The lesion is heterogeneous, predominantly hypointense on FLAIR and T1, with intense enhancement on post-gadolinium series. It presents some small pseudo-cystic areas that are hyperintense on T2 and FLAIR and hypointense on T1 without enhancement. It measures approximately 38 x 25 mm in its largest axial diameter, 36 mm in the anteroposterior direction, and 27 mm in height. The lesion is surrounded by perilesional vasogenic edema that is hyperintense on T2 and FLAIR. The lesion exerts a mild mass effect on the fourth ventricle and causes slight caudal displacement of the right cerebellar tonsil into the foramen magnum. Two small nodular enhancement foci are observed at the right posterobasal level measuring 5 mm and at the right anterosuperior cerebellar level measuring 4 mm. The rest of the cerebellum shows no significant abnormalities.
- Brainstem: Unremarkable
- Midline: Unremarkable
- Supratentorial Ventricular System: Normal shape and size
- Cortical Sulci and Cisterns: Preserved
- Cerebral Parenchyma: Normal morphology and signal intensity in both gray and white matter
In the post-gadolinium series, no other pathological parenchymal or meningeal enhancements are observed.

Imaging Comment:
Right cerebellar intraparenchymal lesion with a heterogeneous appearance, showing intense post-contrast enhancement and surrounded by perilesional vasogenic edema. It exerts a mild mass effect on the fourth ventricle and causes caudal displacement of the right cerebellar tonsil. Small satellite enhancing nodules in the right cerebellar hemisphere.

report_to_rate:
MRT Neurokranium                                                               

Mittelständiger Interhemisphärenspalt. Symmetrischer Seitenventrikel. Entfaltete basale Zisternen. Keine Liquorzirkulationsstörung. In der DWI Nachweis einer fokalen Diffusionsrestriktion (hyperintens in der TRACE, flau hypointens in der ADC, T2w demarkiert) mit 7x4mm in der linksseitigen Capsula interna resp. Globus pallidum Spitze. Geringe Diffusionsrestriktion im linksseitigen Caput nuclei caudati und anterioren Drittel des Putamens. In der SWI keine pathologischen Suszeptibilitätsartefakte. In der T2 TIRM konfluierende mikroangiopathische Veränderungen periventrikulär und subkortikal. Nasennebenhöhlen und Mastoidzellen frei belüftet. Unauffällige Orbitae.
Beurteilung
Nachweis einer subakuten fokalen Ischämie in der rechtsseitigen Capsula interna resp. in der Spitze des Globus pallidum rechts, sowie, etwas flauer, im Caput nuclei caudati und anteriores Putamen rechts.
Konfluierende mikroangiopathische Leukenzephalopathie.

translation:
MRI of the Brain

The interhemispheric fissure is of normal wiRXh. The lateral ventricles are symmetrical. Basal cisterns are well-defined. No evidence of cerebrospinal fluid circulation disturbance. DWI reveals a focal diffusion restriction (hyperintense on TRACE, mildly hypointense on ADC, demarcated on T2-weighted images) measuring 7x4mm in the left internal capsule and the tip of the globus pallidus. There is slight diffusion restriction in the left head of the caudate nucleus and the anterior third of the putamen. SWI shows no pathological susceptibility artifacts. T2 TIRM images show confluent microangiopathic changes periventricularly and subcortically. Paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are well-aerated. Orbits are unremarkable.

Conclusion
Evidence of a subacute focal ischemia in the left internal capsule and the tip of the left globus pallidus, as well as, to a lesser extent, in the left head of the caudate nucleus and anterior putamen. Confluent microangiopathic leukoencephalopathy.

translation:
CT Head

The interhemispheric fissure is midline. The lateral ventricles are symmetrically displayed, with well-developed basal cisterns and no evidence of cerebrospinal fluid circulation disturbance. There is no acute intracranial hemorrhage. Normal gray-white matter differentiation is observed, with no newly demarcated infarct. No old parenchymal defects are present. There are no hypodensities in the white matter. No fractures of the skull base, skull vault, or midface are detected. The paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are well-aerated. The orbits appear unremarkable.

Impression
- No acute intracranial hemorrhage.
- No fracture of the skull vault.

report_to_rate:
IRM CEREBRALE
INDICATION
Patient de 79 ans suivi pour des troubles cognitifs d'origine vasculaire probable. Aggravation des performances cognitives depuis mars 2023.
PROTOCOLE
Séquences axiales diffusion, SWI, 3D T1 EG, 3D FLAIR.
RESULTATComparaison à l’IRM du 01/10/2023 et du 04/01/2021.
Pas de lésion ischémique ou hémorragique récente.Pas de syndrome de masse intracrânien.Stabilité des hypersignaux FLAIR confluents de la substance blanche profonde périventriculaire, des centres semi-ovales et centropontique, en rapport avec des lésions de leucopathie vasculaire classée FAZEKAS 2 + 2.Aspect inchangé largement espaces de Virchow-Robin.Stabilité des microsaignements chroniques disséminés en infra- et supra-tentorielle, centrale et périphérique.L’ensemble restant compatible avec une maladie des petites artères.Stabilité de l’élargissement du système ventriculaire et des espaces liquidiens péri-cérébraux, en rapport avec une atrophie cortico-sous-corticale modérée sans prédominance lobaire évidente.Discrète atrophie hippocampique bilatérale à prédominance gauche (Scheltens 2 à droite et 1 à gauche).Ligne médiane en place. Pas de signe d'engagement cérébral.Stabilité du comblement des cellules mastoïdiennes droites.
CONCLUSION 
Stabilité de la leucopathie vasculaire FAZEKAS 2 + 2 et des microsaignements chroniques diffus, restant compatible avec une atteinte des petites artères. Stabilité de l'atrophie cortico-sous-corticale modérée et de l'atrophie hippocampique SCHELTENS 2 à gauche et 1 à droite.

translation:
BRAIN MRI

INDICATION
The patient is a 79-year-old being monitored for cognitive impairments likely due to vascular causes. There has been a worsening of cognitive performance since March 2023.

PROTOCOL
Axial diffusion sequences, SWI, 3D T1 EG, 3D FLAIR.

RESULTS
Comparison with MRIs from 01/10/2023 and 04/01/2021.

No recent ischemic or hemorrhagic lesions. No intracranial mass effect. The FLAIR hyperintensities in the deep periventricular white matter, semi-oval centers, and centropontine areas remain stable, consistent with vascular leukoencephalopathy classified as FAZEKAS 2 + 2. The appearance of the Virchow-Robin spaces is largely unchanged. The chronic microbleeds scattered in both infra- and supra-tentorial regions, both central and peripheral, remain stable. Overall, these findings are compatible with small vessel disease. The enlargement of the ventricular system and the pericerebral fluid spaces is stable, associated with moderate cortico-subcortical atrophy without any obvious lobar predominance. There is mild bilateral hippocampal atrophy, more pronounced on the left (Scheltens score 2 on the right and 1 on the left). The midline structures are in place. No signs of brain herniation. The filling of the right mastoid cells remains stable.

CONCLUSION
The vascular leukoencephalopathy classified as FAZEKAS 2 + 2 and the diffuse chronic microbleeds remain stable, consistent with small vessel disease. The moderate cortico-subcortical atrophy and the hippocampal atrophy (SCHELTENS score 2 on the right and 1 on the left) are also stable.

Technique: Coronary angiography with selective visualization of the coronary arteries.
Findings: The left coronary artery exhibits a high-grade stenosis in the region of the main stem (RCA). The right coronary artery is unremarkable.
Conclusion: High-grade stenosis of the main stem of the left coronary artery.

report_to_rate:
Descripción y hallazgos  
Fosa posterior:  
Lesión expansiva extraaxial en cisterna cerebelo pontina izquierda hiperintensa en secuencia FLAIR y T2, que presenta realce intenso y homogéneo en la serie postcontraste. Dicha lesión mide aproximadamente 31 mm anteroposterior por 17 mm transversal y 23 mm de altura. Presenta signo de cola dural. Contacta con el poro acústico del lado izquierdo, sin agrandamiento del mismo. El CAI izquierdo se encuentra libre en su tercio medio e inferior.  
Se aprecia compresión extrínseca de pedúnculo cerebeloso medio izquierdo. Provoca desplazamiento en sentido superior del quinto par izquierdo.  
Flujo conservado en seno sigmoideo izquierdo.  
Se aprecia compresión extrínseca de parte lateral izquierda del cuarto ventrículo.  
No se observan alteraciones en la intensidad de señal del tronco cerebral y cerebelo.  
Línea media: Sin particularidades  
Sistema ventricular supratentorial: Forma y tamaño habitual  
Surcos corticales y cisternas: Conservados  
Parénquima cerebral: Aisladas imágenes puntiformes hiperintensas en secuencia FLAIR en sustancia blanca profunda bihemisférica de aspecto inespecífico y escasamente significativas. No se identifican lesiones vasculares recientes en secuencia de difusión. No se observan lesiones hemorrágicas en secuencia eco de gradiente.  

Secuencia angiográfica:  
Arterias carótidas internas intracraneanas: Sin particularidades  
Arterias cerebrales anteriores: Sin particularidades  
Arterias cerebrales medias: Sin particularidades  
Sistema vertebrobasilar: Sin particularidades, origen fetal de arteria cerebral posterior derecha con arteria comunicante posterior derecha permeable.  

Comentario imagenológico:  
Lesión expansiva sin características de probable meningioma en cisterna cerebelo pontina izquierda con las características previamente descritas. El resto del examen y la secuencia angiográfica no evidenciaron alteraciones de significación.

translation:
Description and Findings

Posterior Fossa:
There is an extra-axial mass in the left cerebellopontine cistern that appears hyperintense on FLAIR and T2 sequences, showing intense and homogeneous enhancement on post-contrast series. The lesion measures approximately 31 mm anteroposteriorly, 17 mm transversely, and 23 mm in height. It exhibits a dural tail sign. It contacts the left acoustic meatus without enlargement. The left internal auditory canal is clear in its middle and inner thirds. There is extrinsic compression of the left middle cerebellar peduncle, causing superior displacement of the left fifth cranial nerve. The flow in the left sigmoid sinus is preserved. There is extrinsic compression of the left lateral part of the fourth ventricle. No signal intensity abnormalities are observed in the brainstem and cerebellum.

Midline: Unremarkable

Supratentorial Ventricular System: Normal shape and size

Cortical Sulci and Cisterns: Preserved

Cerebral Parenchyma: Isolated punctate hyperintense images on FLAIR sequence in the deep white matter of both hemispheres, appearing nonspecific and of little significance. No recent vascular lesions are identified on diffusion sequence. No hemorrhagic lesions are observed on gradient echo sequence.

Angiographic Sequence:
Intracranial Internal Carotid Arteries: Unremarkable
Anterior Cerebral Arteries: Unremarkable
Middle Cerebral Arteries: Unremarkable
Vertebrobasilar System: Unremarkable, with fetal origin of the right posterior cerebral artery and a patent right posterior communicating artery.

Imaging Comment:
Expansive lesion with characteristics suggestive of a probable meningioma in the left cerebellopontine cistern, as previously described. The rest of the examination and the angiographic sequence did not reveal any significant abnormalities.

There are small parameniscal cysts at the anterior horn of the lateral meniscus. Collateral ligaments are intact. Bone marrow signal is unremarkable. The visualized musculature appears normal.

Impression:
-No evidence of significant cartilage damage.
-Isolated parameniscal cysts at the anterior horn of the lateral meniscus.

report_to_rate:
Indication : Tumeur osseuse avec envahissement des parties molles.
Techniciens d’Imagerie : 
Secrétaire : 

IRM DE L’EPAULE  GAUCHE

Technique : 
On réalise des séquences T1en densité de proton Fat Sat coronale, sagittale, axiale puis  T1 coronale avec injection de gadolinium.

Résultat
Sur le plan ostéo articulaire
Il est objectivé la présence d’une formation lacunaire métaphyso épiphysaire proximale humérale gauche mesurée à 23,9mm x 20mm x 21mm dont la matrice se présente en hypersignal T2, hyposignal T1, non rehaussée après injection du produit de contraste.
Il est objectivé une rupture corticale au niveau de la face antérieure de la lésion avec présence d’une collection liquidienne en sous deltoïdienne de minime abondance.
On note une conservation de la sphéricité céphalique humérale.
Présence d’une apposition périostée para lésionnelle.
Pas d’anomalie des autres structures osseuses notamment de la clavicule et de la scapula. 

Sur le plan tendino-musculaire 
On note la présence d’une collection liquidienne sous deltoïdienne sans anomalie de signal du muscle 
On ne note pas d’anomalie des autres structures musculaires notamment de la coiffe des rotateurs.
Pas d’anomalie de signal des autres structures musculaires de l’épaule gauche.
CONCLUSION

Aspect IRM d’une lésion lacunaire métaphyso épiphysaire proximale humérale droite rapidement évolutive responsable d’une rupture corticale avec présence d’une collection liquidienne sous deltoïdienne de minime abondance.
Pas d’envahissement des autres structures musculo-tendineuses de l’épaule.
Pas d’anomalie de la scapula ni de la clavicule.

translation:
Indication: Bone tumor with soft tissue involvement.  
Imaging Technicians:  
Secretary:  

MRI OF THE LEFT SHOULDER  

Technique:  
Proton density T1 sequences with Fat Sat in coronal, sagittal, and axial planes, followed by coronal T1 with gadolinium contrast injection.

Findings  
Osteoarticular findings:  
A lytic lesion is identified in the proximal metaphyseal-epiphyseal region of the left humerus, measuring 23.9mm x 20mm x 21mm. The lesion matrix shows T2 hyperintensity, T1 hypointensity, and does not enhance post-contrast.  
There is cortical breach on the anterior aspect of the lesion with a small subdeltoid fluid collection.  
The humeral head maintains its spherical shape.  
There is periosteal reaction adjacent to the lesion.  
No abnormalities are noted in other bony structures, including the clavicle and scapula.  

Tendinous-muscular findings:  
A subdeltoid fluid collection is present without any signal abnormality in the muscle.  
No abnormalities are noted in other muscular structures, including the rotator cuff.  
No signal abnormalities in other muscular structures of the left shoulder.  

CONCLUSION  

MRI appearance of a rapidly evolving lytic lesion in the proximal metaphyseal-epiphyseal region of the left humerus, causing cortical breach with a small subdeltoid fluid collection.  
No involvement of other musculo-tendinous structures of the shoulder.  
No abnormalities in the scapula or clavicle.

report_to_rate:
RM CUORE SENZA E CON MDC EV
Esame eseguito con paziente a riposo, utilizzando sequenze Cine b-SSFP secondo piani paralleli ai principali assi cardiaci, sequenze STIR, sequenze MDE acquisite dopo iniezione e.v. di mdc Gadovist, dose 0.1 mmol/Kg. Biometria: altezza: 172 cm; peso: 100.5 kg; superficie corporea/BSA: 2.19 m^2 (sec. Mosteller).
Quesito diagnostico: approfondimento in paziente con IMA (2012) trattata con CABG ed insufficienza cardiaca cronica a FE ridotta.
Ventricolo sinistro: aspetto dilatato e pseudo-aneurismatico dei segmenti medio-apicali, con assottigliamento della parete miocardica a sede apicale. Moderata riduzione della funzione sistolica globale a riposo (FE: 37%) con discinesia dell'apice in toto ed ipo-acinesia dei segmenti anteriore e settali, in sede medio-ventricolare ed apicale e laterale in sede
 basale e medio-ventricolare. Lieve ipertrofia del SIV (14 mm).
Atrio sinistro: di dimensioni cavitarie lievemente aumentate, con insufficienza mitralica di grado lieve (+/++++).
Ventricolo destro: di dimensioni cavitarie nella norma, con conservati spessori parietali, con moderata riduzione della funzione sistolica globale a riposo.
Atrio destro: di dimensioni lievemente aumentate, con insufficienza tricuspidalica di grado lieve (+/++++).
Nelle sequenze STIR non si apprezzano aree di alterato segnale intra-miocardico. Si evidenziano fenomeni di stasi ematica in sede apicale endo-cavitaria.
Studio post-contrastrografico: Si apprezzano estese aree confluenti di impregnazione tardiva di mezzo di contrasto, a carico dei segmenti discinetici ed ipo-acinetici sovra-descritti, con prevalente pattern di distribuzione sub-endocardico;analoghe aree si apprezzano a carico dei muscoli papillari.
Conclusioni: Ventricolo destro dilatato, con aspetto pseudo-aneurismatico e con riduzione della funzione sistolica globale a riposo (FE: 37%); discinesia dell'apice in toto ed ipo-acinesia dei segmenti anteriore e settali, a sede medio ventricolare ed apicale e del segmento laterale, in sede basale e medio-ventricolare. Agli stessi livelli si apprezzano estese aree di necrosi miocardica, con prevalente pattern di distribuzione sub-endocardica a livello dei segmenti miocardici discinetici ed ipo-acinetici sovradescritti, oltre che in corrispondenza dei muscoli papillari.

translation:
CARDIAC MRI WITH AND WITHOUT CONTRAST

The examination was performed with the patient at rest, using Cine b-SSFP sequences aligned with the main cardiac axes, STIR sequences, and MDE sequences acquired after intravenous injection of Gadovist contrast agent, at a dose of 0.1 mmol/kg. Biometric data: height: 172 cm; weight: 100.5 kg; body surface area/BSA: 2.19 m² (according to Mosteller).

Clinical question: Further evaluation in a patient with a history of myocardial infarction (2012) treated with CABG and chronic heart failure with reduced ejection fraction.

Left Ventricle: Dilated and pseudo-aneurysmal appearance of the mid-apical segments, with thinning of the myocardial wall at the apex. Moderate reduction in global systolic function at rest (EF: 37%) with dyskinesia of the entire apex and hypo-akinesia of the anterior and septal segments at the mid-ventricular and apical levels, and lateral segment at the basal and mid-ventricular levels. Mild hypertrophy of the interventricular septum (14 mm).

Left Atrium: Slightly enlarged chamber dimensions, with mild mitral regurgitation (+/++++).

Right Ventricle: Normal chamber dimensions, with preserved wall thickness, and moderate reduction in global systolic function at rest.

Right Atrium: Slightly enlarged dimensions, with mild tricuspid regurgitation (+/++++).

STIR sequences do not reveal areas of altered intra-myocardial signal. Blood stasis phenomena are noted in the endo-cavitary apical region.

Post-contrast study: Extensive confluent areas of late contrast enhancement are observed in the dyskinetic and hypo-akinetic segments described above, predominantly with a sub-endocardial distribution pattern; similar areas are noted in the papillary muscles.

Conclusions: Dilated left ventricle with a pseudo-aneurysmal appearance and reduced global systolic function at rest (EF: 37%); dyskinesia of the entire apex and hypo-akinesia of the anterior and septal segments at the mid-ventricular and apical levels, and the lateral segment at the basal and mid-ventricular levels. Extensive areas of myocardial necrosis are noted at the same levels, predominantly with a sub-endocardial distribution pattern in the dyskinetic and hypo-akinetic myocardial segments described above, as well as in the papillary muscles.

report_to_rate:
CT Thorax                                                                                                                            
Kein Erguss. Bekannte Lungentuberkulose mit Läsion in folgender Lokalisation: Große wandverdickte Kaverne im apikalen Unterlappensegment rechts exemplarisch mit einem Maximaldurchmesser von 5,5 cm und leichte Retraktion des schrägen Interlobiums. Die Läsion ist im Vergleich leicht größenregredient und schärfer demarkiert. Die Satelliten Läsionen etwas kaudal mit aktuell max. 9 mm versus VU 13 mm ebenfalls leicht regredient. Weitere Läsionen finden sich dorsobasal rechts subpleural sowie kavernös deutlich regredient im apikalen Unterlappen links sowie ausgedehnte Kaverne im posteroapikal im Oberlappen rechts. In letzterer Läsion zeigen die perifokalen Infiltrationen eine signifikante Regredienz. Eine vorbestehende peribronchiale Verdichtung im dorsobasalen Unterlappen rechts ist weitestgehend regredient bis auf einen minimalen Restbefund mit 7mm. Kein Nachweis neuer Läsionen.
Die hilären Lymphknoten leicht akzentuiert und insgesamt regredient exemplarisch paratracheal rechts. Aorta normkalibrig. Geringer Aortenkalk. Mäßig Koronarkalk. Das pulmonalarterielles System ist regelrecht perfundiert. Kein Perikarderguss. Partiell erfasste Oberbauch mit schlanken Nebennieren. Die Oberbauchorgane in gegebener Kontrastmittelphase regelrecht. Schilddrüse nicht vergrößert. Axillen Lymphom frei.
Beurteilung
Kein Nachweis von Lungenembolien.
Bekannte Lungentuberkulose mit bekannten kavernösen Läsion im Oberlappen rechts, apikaler Unterlappen rechts sowie Unterlappen links. Regrediente Lymphadenopathie mediastinal.
Mäßige Coronarsklerose.

translation:
CT Chest

No effusion. Known pulmonary tuberculosis with lesions in the following locations: Large thick-walled cavity in the apical segment of the right lower lobe, with a maximum diameter of 5.5 cm, and slight retraction of the oblique interlobar fissure. The lesion is slightly reduced in size and more sharply demarcated compared to previous imaging. Satellite lesions slightly caudal, currently with a maximum of 9 mm compared to 13 mm previously, also show slight regression. Additional lesions are found dorsobasally on the right, subpleural, and cavitary, significantly regressed in the apical lower lobe on the left, as well as an extensive cavity in the posteroapical region of the right upper lobe. In the latter lesion, the perifocal infiltrations show significant regression. A pre-existing peribronchial consolidation in the dorsobasal right lower lobe is largely regressed, with only a minimal residual finding of 7 mm. No evidence of new lesions.

The hilar lymph nodes are slightly accentuated and overall regressed, exemplified by the paratracheal nodes on the right. Aorta is of normal caliber. Minimal aortic calcification. Moderate coronary calcification. The pulmonary arterial system is normally perfused. No pericardial effusion. Partially visualized upper abdomen with slender adrenal glands. Upper abdominal organs appear normal in the given contrast phase. Thyroid is not enlarged. Axillary regions are free of lymphadenopathy.

Impression

No evidence of pulmonary embolism. Known pulmonary tuberculosis with cavitary lesions in the right upper lobe, right apical lower lobe, and left lower lobe. Regressing mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Moderate coronary sclerosis.

report_to_rate:
IDENTITE DU PATIENT :  
AGE : 63 ANS  
SEXE : M  
EXAMEN DEMANDE : BILI-IRM  
INDICATION : BILAN DE CHOLESTASE  
MEDECIN TRAITANT :  

TECHNIQUE :  
Acquisition sur l’abdomen en axial T2TSE, T2 SPAIR, BTFE, BH, Diffusion b1000, M Dixon sans et avec injection de gadolinium (artérielle, portale et tardive).

RESULTATS :

Le foie est augmenté de taille (flèche médio-claviculaire à 213 mm) de contours irréguliers et de signal hétérogène lié à la présence de multiples processus occupants polycycliques de tailles variables dont le plus volumineux mesure 133 mm. Ces nodules sont tissulo-nécrotiques avec des logettes nécrotiques et d’autres hémorragiques hypersignal en T1. Ils présentent des parois et septas épais avec des portions charnues hypersignal en Diffusion B1000 avec restriction de l’ADC 0,44.10-3 mm2/s et une prise de contraste intense précoce en plateau de type 2. Il s’agit de lésions d’allure néoplasique vraisemblablement secondaire.  
La vésicule biliaire est alithiasique à paroi fine et régulière.  
Absence de dilatation des voies biliaires intra et extra-hépatiques.  
La rate mesure 110,2 mm et est homogène.  
Les reins sont d’aspect normal avec un diamètre bipolaire estimé à 103,1 mm à droite et 132,5 mm à gauche.  
Les surrénales sont de morphologies normales et de signal homogène sans lésion suspecte ni nodule.  
Absence d’adénomégalie et de lésion osseuse.  
Absence d’épanchement intra-péritonéal.  
Le pancréas est homogène, de contours réguliers.  
Le canal de Wirsung est de taille normale.  
Intégrité de la graisse mésentérique et des anses digestives.  
Absence de lésion osseuse rachidienne et musculo-tendineuse.

CONCLUSION :

HEPATOMEGALIE HETEROGENE AVEC MULTIPLES PROCESSUS OCCUPANTS NODULAIRES TISSULO-NECROTIQUES HEMORRAGIQUES D’ALLURE NEOPLASIQUE VRAISEMBLABLEMENT SECONDAIRE NECESSITANT LA RECHERCHE D’UN PRIMITIF.  
PRESENCE D’ANOMALIE DE LA VESICULE BILIAIRE ET DES VOIES BILIAIRES

translation:
PATIENT IDENTITY:  
AGE: 63 YEARS  
SEX: M  
REQUESTED EXAM: MR  
INDICATION: CHOLESTASIS EVALUATION  
REFERRING PHYSICIAN:  

TECHNIQUE:  
Imaging of the abdomen using axial T2TSE, T2 SPAIR, BTFE, BH, Diffusion b1000, M Dixon without and with gadolinium injection (arterial, portal, and delayed phases).

RESULTS:

The liver is enlarged (midclavicular line at 2.13 mm) with irregular contours and heterogeneous signal due to the presence of multiple space-occupying polycyclic processes of varying sizes, the largest measuring 133 mm. These nodules are tissue-necrotic with necrotic and hemorrhagic compartments showing high signal on T1. They have thick walls and septa with solid portions showing high signal on Diffusion B1000 with ADC restriction at 0.44 x 10^-3 mm2/s and intense early plateau-type contrast enhancement (type 2). These are likely secondary neoplastic lesions.  
The gallbladder is free of stones with thin and regular walls.  
No dilation of intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile ducts.  
The spleen measures 110.2 mm and is homogeneous.  
The kidneys appear normal with a bipolar diameter estimated at 103.1 mm on the right and 132.5 mm on the left.  
The adrenal glands have normal morphology and homogeneous signal without suspicious lesions or nodules.  
No lymphadenopathy or bone lesions.  
No intraperitoneal fluid collection.  
The pancreas is homogeneous with regular contours.  
The Wirsung duct is of normal size.  
The mesenteric fat and bowel loops are intact.  
No spinal or musculoskeletal lesions.

CONCLUSION:

HETEROGENEOUS HEPATOMEGALY WITH MULTIPLE TISSUE-NECROTIC HEMORRHAGIC NODULAR PROCESSES LIKELY SECONDARY NEOPLASTIC IN NATURE, REQUIRING SEARCH FOR A PRIMARY SOURCE.  
NO ABNORMALITIES OF THE GALLBLADDER AND BILE DUCTS.

report_to_rate:
IRM HYPOPHYSAIRE  

Indication :Contrôle d'une lésion hypophysaire non sécrétant découverte fortuitement.
Protocole :Séquences 3D T1 spin écho, coronales T2 spin écho, coronales T1 dynamique après injection, 3D T1 spin écho sur l'encéphale après injection.

Résultats comparaison à l'IRM du 12 juin 2022
On retrouve la formation nodulaire latéro-sellaire droite mesurée à 12 x 9 x7 de diamètre contre 10 x 8 x 7 mm, en hyposignal T1, hyposignal T2 en dehors de quelques composantes liquidiennes punctiformes, visualisées dans un défect au sein de l'hypophyse après injection.L'hypophyse saine semble refoulée vers le haut et la gauche.Persistance d'un hypersignal T1 spontané de la posthypophyse.Déviation de la tige pituitaire vers la gauche,Cette formation nodulaire présente un contact étroit avec le chiasma optique, refoulé vers le haut sans signe de souffrance.Contact étroit avec le sinus caverneux et l'artère carotide interne droite sans envahissement (Knosp 1) sans sténose de celle-ci.
Conclusion :Globale stabilité en taille de la formation nodulaire latéro-sellaire droite, présentant un contact étroit avec le chiasma optique sans signe de souffrance.

translation:
**MRI of the Pituitary Gland**

**Reason for Exam:** Follow-up on a non-secreting pituitary lesion that was incidentally discovered.

**Protocol:** 3D T1 spin echo sequences, coronal T2 spin echo, dynamic coronal T1 post-contrast, 3D T1 spin echo of the brain post-contrast.

**Results Compared to MRI from June 12, 2022:**

A nodular formation on the right side of the sella is observed, measuring 12 x 9 x 7 mm, compared to the previous 10 x 8 x 7 mm. It shows low signal intensity on T1 and T2, except for a few small fluid components seen within a defect in the pituitary gland after contrast injection. The healthy part of the pituitary gland appears to be pushed upwards and to the left. There is a persistent spontaneous high signal on T1 in the posterior pituitary. The pituitary stalk is deviated to the left. This nodular formation is in close contact with the optic chiasm, which is displaced upwards but shows no signs of distress. It is also in close contact with the cavernous sinus and the right internal carotid artery without invasion (Knosp grade 1) and without narrowing of the artery.

**Conclusion:** Overall stability in the size of the right lateral sella nodular formation, which is in close contact with the optic chiasm but shows no signs of distress.

A nodular formation on the right side of the sella is observed, measuring 12 x 9 x 7 mm, compared to the previous 10 x 8 x 7 mm. It shows low signal intensity on T1 and T2, except for a few small fluid components seen within a defect in the pituitary gland after contrast injection. The healthy part of the pituitary gland appears to be pushed upwards and to the left. There is a persistent spontaneous high signal on T1 in the posterior pituitary. The pituitary stalk is deviated to the left. This nodular formation is in close contact with the optic chiasm, which is displaced upwards but shows no signs of distress. It is also in close contact with the cavernous sinus and the right internal carotid artery without invasion (Knosp grade 1) and without narrowing of the artery.

**Conclusion:** Overall stability in the size of the left lateral sella nodular formation, which is in close contact with the optic chiasm but shows no signs of distress.
---

report_to_rate:
Renseignements cliniques : Mictions rapprochées (hypertrophie bénigne de la prostate)
Technique : Réalisation de l’examen à l’aide d’un transducteur de 3,5 MHz

RESULTATS
L’examen ultra-sonographique réalisé en sus pubienne objective une glande prostatique de taille augmentée dont la biométrie est de : 
64 mm de hauteur
61 mm de largeur
58 mm d’épaisseur, soit un volume de 117 cm3. 
Son échostructure est hétérogène remaniée par de multiples calcifications et ses contours sont réguliers. 
Le bas fond vésical est surélevé par une protrusion intra vésicale du lobe médian sur 8 mm.
Les vésicules séminales sont sans anomalie.   
Les reins sont de morpho-biométrie consignée dans le tableau ci-dessous :
Reins
Hauteur (mm)
Largeur (mm)
Epaisseur (mm)
Droit
92
45
40
Gauche
94
46
39

Conservation de la différenciation parenchymosinusale et corticomédullaire.
Pas d’anomalie des cavités pyélocalicielles ni image de lithiase.  
On note deux formations arrondies anéchogènes homogènes, aux contours réguliers avec renforcement postérieur, polaire supérieure et para pyélique du rein droit, mesurant respectivement 28 mm et 23mm de grand axe.
Vessie de bonne capacité, de contenu transonore alithiasique, à paroi épaissie de façon diffuse et régulière mesurée à 10 mm.  
Résidu post mictionnel non significatif.
CONCLUSION
Arguments ultrasonographiques d’une hypertrophie prostatique hétérogène de 117ml de volume avec un IPP de grade II responsable d’une vessie de lutte sans retentissement sur le haut appareil urinaire : à corréler aux PSA.
Kystes simples rénaux gauches.
Rein droit et vésicules séminales normaux.

translation:
Clinical Information: Frequent urination (benign prostatic hyperplasia)  
Technique: Examination performed using a 3.5 MHz transducer  

RESULTS  
The suprapubic ultrasound examination reveals an enlarged prostate gland with the following dimensions:  
- Height: 64 mm  
- WiRXh: 61 mm  
- Thickness: 58 mm, resulting in a volume of 117 cm³.  
Its echotexture is heterogeneous, altered by multiple calcifications, and its contours are regular.  
The bladder base is elevated by an 8 mm intravesical protrusion of the median lobe.  
The seminal vesicles appear normal.  
The kidneys have the following morpho-biometric details:  

| Kidneys | Height (mm) | WiRXh (mm) | Thickness (mm) |  
|---------|-------------|------------|----------------|  
| Right   | 92          | 45         | 40             |  
| Left    | 94          | 46         | 39             |  

Preservation of the parenchymal-sinus and cortico-medullary differentiation.  
No abnormalities in the pyelocaliceal cavities or signs of lithiasis.  
Two rounded, anechoic, homogeneous formations with regular contours and posterior enhancement are noted at the upper pole and parapelvic region of the right kidney, measuring 28 mm and 23 mm in their longest axis, respectively.  
The bladder has good capacity, is anechoic and free of stones, with a diffusely and regularly thickened wall measuring 10 mm.  
Post-void residual volume is not significant.  

CONCLUSION  
Ultrasonographic evidence of heterogeneous prostatic hypertrophy with a volume of 117 ml and an IPP of grade II, resulting in a compensatory bladder without impact on the upper urinary tract: correlation with PSA is recommended.  
Simple right renal cysts.  
Normal left kidney and seminal vesicles.

report_to_rate:
MR Arthrographie

Kein Nachweis eines Knochenödems. Signalinhomogenität an der Insertion des M. infraspinatus sowie leichter auch an der Insertion des Musculus supraspinatus. Es findet sich jedoch kein Durchtritt von Kontrastmittel in die Bursa subacromialis und auf den T2-gewichteten Sequenzen keine eindeutige fokale Konturunterbrechung der Sehnen. Diskrete Signalanhebung am Ansatz des M. subscapularis. Keine relevante Muskelatrophie der Rotatorenmanschette mit nur ganz vereinzelten Fettstreifen (Goutallier 0-1). Die Bizepssehne stellt sich im Verlauf am Übergang in den Sulcus intertubercularis ausgedünnt und proximal mit Signalanhebung und etwas aufgefächert dar. Kurze Bizepssehne unauffällig. Keine Gelenkknorpeldefekte. Intaktes Labrum. AC-Gelenksarthrose mit verdickter Gelenkkapsel.

Beurteilung: Partialruptur der langen Bizepssehne proximal. Deg. Veränderungen der Rotatorenmanschette mit kleinen Partialläsionen an der Insertion des M. supra- und infraspinatus. Atrophie der Rotatorenmanschette.

Die Bizepssehne stellt sich im Verlauf am Übergang in den Sulcus intertubercularis ausgedünnt und proximal mit Signalanhebung  und etwas aufgefächert dar. Kurze Bizepssehne unauffällig.

translation:
MR Arthrography

No evidence of bone edema. 
Signal inhomogeneity at the insertion of the infraspinatus muscle and, to a lesser extent, at the insertion of the supraspinatus muscle. However, there is no contrast medium penetration into the subacromial bursa, and no definite focal disruption of the tendon contours is seen on T2-weighted sequences. There is a slight signal increase at the insertion of the subscapularis muscle. 
No significant muscle atrophy of the rotator cuff, with only a few isolated fatty streaks (Goutallier 0-1). 
The biceps tendon appears thinned at the transition into the intertubercular sulcus, with proximal signal increase and slight fraying. The short biceps tendon is unremarkable. 
No joint cartilage defects. Intact labrum. 
AC joint arthrosis with thickened joint capsule. 
Impression: 
Partial tear of the proximal long head of the biceps tendon. 
Degenerative changes of the rotator cuff with small partial tears at the insertion of the supraspinatus and infraspinatus muscles. 
No atrophy of the rotator cuff.

report_to_rate: Klinik, Fragestellung, rechtfertigende Indikation: Dialysepflichtige Niereninsuffizienz. Erbitte Implantation eines getunnelten Dialysekatheters.  Methodik: Rückenlage. Sonographie des rechten Halses. Wischdesinfektion und sterile Abdeckung. Lokalanästhesie mit ca. 40 ml Xylonest 1%. Ultraschall-gesteuerte Punktion der V. jugularis interna dextra und Einlage einer Splittschleuse. Tunnelung des Dialysekatheters und Einführung über die Schleuse. Entfernung der Schleuse. Lagekontrolle des Katheters unter Durchleuchtung. Flusskontrolle beider Schenkel. Blockung beider Schenkel mit Citratlösung 4% (Citralock). Verband. Durchleuchtungszeit: 0,6 min Fluoro. 109,14 µGym2.  Befund: Rechts juguläre Einlage eines getunnelten Dialysekatheters (GlidePath Long-Term, 23 cm Länge Muffe-Katheterspitze).  Beurteilung: Technisch erfolgreiche und komplikationslose Anlage eines getunnelten Hämodialysekatheters. Projektion der Katheterspitze im rechten Vorhof.

translation:
Clinical Information, Question, Justification: Dialysis-dependent renal insufficiency. Request for implantation of a tunneled dialysis catheter. 

Method: Supine position. Ultrasound of the right neck. Skin disinfection and sterile draping. Local anesthesia with approximately 40 ml of Xylonest 1%. Ultrasound-guided puncture of the right internal jugular vein and insertion of a peel-away sheath. Tunneling of the dialysis catheter and introduction through the sheath. Removal of the sheath. Position check of the catheter under fluoroscopy. Flow check of both lumens. Locking of both lumens with 4% citrate solution (Citralock). Dressing applied. Fluoroscopy time: 0.6 min. Fluoro. 109.14 µGy/m².

Findings: Right jugular insertion of a tunneled dialysis catheter (GlidePath Long-Term, 23 cm length from hub to catheter tip).

Conclusion: Technically successful and complication-free placement of a tunneled hemodialysis catheter. Projection of the catheter tip in the right atrium.

report_to_rate:
TOMOGRAFÍA COMPUTADA MULTICORTE DE TÓRAX
DATOS CLÍNICOS: Derrame pleural. 
TÉCNICA:
Se efectuó estudio de Tomografía Computada Multicorte de tórax, con cortes axiales y reconstrucciones multiplanares, sin contraste endovenoso.
HALLAZGOS:
Derrame pleural moderado a severo derecho que condiciona atelectasia total del lóbulo inferior y subtotal del LM.
Nodulillo sobre el LSD de aspecto secuelar.
No se observa derrame pericárdico.
No se identifican adenomegalias axilares, hiliares y mediastinales.
Los cortes visibles del abdomen superior no muestran alteraciones.
CONCLUSIÓN:
Derrame pleural severo izquierdo con áreas de atelectasia pasiva.

translation:
MULTISLICE COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY OF THE CHEST.
CLINICAL DATA: Pleural effusion. 
TECHNIQUE: 
A multislice computed tomography (CT) scan of the chest was performed, with axial cuts and multiplanar reconstructions, without intravenous contrast. 
FINDINGS: 
There is moderate to severe right pleural effusion, causing total atelectasis of the right lower lobe and subtotal atelectasis of the middle lobe. 
A small nodule with a sequelae-like appearance is observed in the right upper lobe. No pericardial effusion is observed. 
No axillary, hilar, or mediastinal adenopathy is identified. 
The visible cuts of the upper abdomen show no abnormalities. 
CONCLUSION: 
Severe right pleural effusion with areas of passive atelectasis.

report_to_rate:
ARTHROGRAMME DE LA HANCHE GAUCHE GUIDÉ PAR FLUOROSCOPIE
 
INFORMATIONS CLINIQUES : évaluer pour déchirure labrale
 
COMPARAISON : Aucune.
 
CONSTATATIONS :
 
La procédure et ses risques (y compris saignement, infection, réaction indésirable aux médicaments et dommage aux structures environnantes) ont été expliqués au patient et un consentement éclairé écrit a été obtenu. 
 
Sous technique stérile, après administration de lidocaïne 1% pour l’anesthésie locale, une aiguille de calibre 22 a été introduite dans l’articulation de la hanche gauche sous guidage fluoroscopique. Une petite quantité de contraste iodé a été injectée pour confirmer le placement intra-articulaire. Ensuite, 12 cc de contraste de gadolinium dilué ont été injectés dans l’articulation de la hanche.
 
L’intervention a été bien tolérée, sans complication immédiate.
 
Le patient a été dirigé vers la salle d’IRM.
 
CONCLUSION :
 
Une injection de gadolinium dilué dans l’articulation de la hanche gauche guidée par fluoroscopie a été réalisée avant l’IRM. 
 
[Ce rapport a été généré à l'aide d'un logiciel de reconnaissance vocale].

translation:
FLUOROSCOPY-GUIDED LEFT HIP ARTHROGRAM
 
CLINICAL INFORMATION: Assess for labral tear
 
COMPARISON: None.
 
FINDINGS:
 
The procedure and its risks (including bleeding, infection, adverse reaction to medication, and damage to surrounding structures) were explained to the patient and written informed consent was obtained. 
 
Under sterile technique, after administration of lidocaine 1% for local anesthesia, a 22-gauge needle was advanced in the left hip joint under fluoroscopic guidance. A small amount of iodine contrast was injected to confirm the intra-articular placement. Then, 12 cc of dilute gadolinium contrast was injected into the hip joint.
 
The procedure was well tolerated, with no immediate complication.
 
The patient was directed to the MRI suite.
 
CONCLUSION:
 
A fluoroscopically-guided left hip joint injection of dilute gadolinium contrast was performed pre-MRI. 
 
[This report was generated using voice recognition software.]

translation:
Brain CT Scan
Date: 05/19/2019

INDICATION:

Evaluation of head trauma in a patient on anticoagulant therapy.

TECHNIQUE:

Non-contrast helical scan.

Contrast Agent:

None

RESULTS:

There is a spontaneously hyperdense right hemispheric subdural collection measuring up to 9 mm in maximum thickness, causing a mass effect with approximately 5 mm of subfalcine herniation. No associated uncal or tonsillar herniation is observed. There is contiguous subarachnoid hemorrhage. A subcentimeter left frontal subcutaneous hematoma is present without associated bony injury. No parenchymal involvement is noted. The cisterns and ventricles are intact. The paranasal sinuses are well-aerated.

CONCLUSION:

Acute right hemispheric subdural hematoma with a maximum thickness of 9 mm, causing approximately 5 mm of subfalcine herniation, associated with contiguous subarachnoid hemorrhage.

report_to_rate:
ANGIO IRM CEREBRALE
 
INDICATION Découverte d'un anévrisme de l'artère cérébrale antérieure, dans un contexte d'oligo-arthrite avec bactériémie à pneumocoque.
TECHNIQUE
Séquences tenseurs diffusion six directions, 3D FLAIR, SWI, 3D TOF, 3D T1 SPACE sans, puis après injection de gadolinium, et 3D T1 MPRAGE post-gadolinium.
Magnetom Sola  
DOTAREM FL INJ 20ML     11   CC   
RESULTATS
Présence d'un anévrisme sacciforme de l'artère cérébrale antérieure droite, dans son segment A2-A3, au niveau de l'artère calloso-marginale, à collet large.
L'anévrisme apparaît irrégulier, mesurant 8 x 4 mm de diamètre pour un collet d'environ 4,5mm. Présence d'une prise de contraste pariétale au niveau de la paroi inférieure de l'anévrisme.
Pas d'autre lésion anévrismale décelable.
 
Quelques rares hypersignaux FLAIR punctiformes de la substance blanche sus-tentorielle, aspécifiques.
Pas de lésion cytotoxique. Pas de lésion hémorragique ou de microbleed décelable.
Absence de collection extra-axiale. Absence d'hydrocéphalie.
Absence d'accident vasculaire cérébral récent ou constitué.
Pas de prise de contraste pathologique parenchymateuse ou méningée décelable.
Pas thrombophlébite cérébrale.
 
CONCLUSION
Anévrisme sacciforme irrégulier de l'artère cérébrale antérieure droite dans son segment A2-A3, mesurant 8 X 4 mm de diamètre. Prise de contraste pariétale au niveau de la paroi inférieure de l'anévrisme. Neuroradiologue interventionnel prévenu des résultats.
Absence de lésion ischémique ou hémorragique décelable par ailleurs.

translation:
CEREBRAL MR ANGIOGRAPHY

INDICATION: Discovery of an anterior cerebral artery aneurysm in the context of oligoarthritis with pneumococcal bacteremia.

TECHNIQUE: Diffusion tensor imaging with six directions, 3D FLAIR, SWI, 3D TOF, 3D T1 SPACE without and then with gadolinium injection, and 3D T1 MPRAGE post-gadolinium. Magnetom Sola. DOTAREM FL INJ 20ML 11 CC.

RESULTS: Presence of a saccular aneurysm of the right anterior cerebral artery in its A2-A3 segment, at the level of the callosomarginal artery, with a wide neck. The aneurysm appears irregular, measuring 8 x 4 mm in diameter with a neck of approximately 4.5 mm. There is contrast enhancement of the wall at the inferior aspect of the aneurysm. No other aneurysmal lesions detected.

A few rare punctate FLAIR hyperintensities in the supratentorial white matter, nonspecific. No cytotoxic lesions. No detectable hemorrhagic lesions or microbleeds. No extra-axial collection. No hydrocephalus. No recent or established cerebrovascular accident. No pathological parenchymal or meningeal contrast enhancement detected. No cerebral thrombophlebitis.

CONCLUSION: Irregular saccular aneurysm of the right anterior cerebral artery in its A2-A3 segment, measuring 8 x 4 mm in diameter. Contrast enhancement of the wall at the inferior aspect of the aneurysm. Interventional neuroradiologist informed of the results. No detectable ischemic or hemorrhagic lesions otherwise.

report_to_rate:
Descripción y hallazgos
Fosa posterior:
-Cuarto ventrículo: Forma y tamaño habitual
-Tronco cerebral: Se confirma la presencia de una lesión focal en hemiprotuberancia derecha. La misma es hiperintensa en T2 y Flair, en difusión b1000, con caída de señal en la cartrografía de CDA, con características de lesión isquémica aguda. No ejerce efecto de masa ni muestra signos de transformación hemorrágica.El resto del tronco encefálico se observan hiperintensidades puntiformes centro protuberancial, de aspecto microvascular crónico.
-Cerebelo: Sin particularidades
Línea media: Sin particularidades
Sistema ventricular supratentorial: Forma y tamaño habitual
Surcos corticales y cisternas: Conservados
Parénquima cerebral: Se reconocen hiperintensidades focales en T2 y Flair comprometiendo la sustancia blanca periventricular y subcortical bilateral, de aspecto vascular crónico. Fazekas grado 3
Se observa una pequeña lesión talámica derecha. La misma es también hiperintensa en Flair y difusión b1000, con caída de señal en la cartrografía de CDA, con características de pequeña lesión isquémica aguda.
Se observan microinfartos lacunares profundos lentículo-capsulares bilaterales.No evidencia de hemorragia intra o extracraneana.
Secuencia angiográfica:
Arterias carótidas internas intracraneanas: Sin particularidades
Arterias cerebrales anteriores: Sin particularidades
Arterias cerebrales medias: Sin particularidades
Sistema vertebrobasilar y arterias cerebrales posteriores: Sin particularidades
Comentario imagenológico:
Pequeñas lesiones isquémicas agudas en hemiprotuberancia derecha y puntiforme talámica derecha, comprometiendo territorio vascular posterior.Signos de leucoencefalopatía de aspecto vascular crónico.
No evidencia de lesión esteno-oclusiva de las arterias intra craneanas.

translation:
Description and Findings

Posterior Fossa:
- Fourth Ventricle: Normal shape and size
- Brainstem: A focal lesion is confirmed in the right hemipons. It appears hyperintense on T2 and FLAIR, as well as on diffusion b1000, with signal drop on ADC mapping, consistent with an acute ischemic lesion. There is no mass effect or signs of hemorrhagic transformation. The rest of the brainstem shows punctate hyperintensities in the central pons, suggestive of chronic microvascular changes.
- Cerebellum: Unremarkable
Midline: Unremarkable
Supratentorial Ventricular System: Normal shape and size
Cortical Sulci and Cisterns: Preserved
Cerebral Parenchyma: Focal hyperintensities on T2 and FLAIR are noted involving the periventricular and subcortical white matter bilaterally, with a chronic vascular appearance. Fazekas grade 3.
A small right thalamic lesion is observed, also hyperintense on FLAIR and diffusion b1000, with signal drop on ADC mapping, consistent with a small acute ischemic lesion.
Deep lacunar microinfarcts are seen in the bilateral lenticulocapsular regions. No evidence of intra- or extracranial hemorrhage.

Angiographic Sequence:
Intracranial Internal Carotid Arteries: Unremarkable
Anterior Cerebral Arteries: Unremarkable
Middle Cerebral Arteries: Unremarkable
Vertebrobasilar System and Posterior Cerebral Arteries: Unremarkable

Imaging Comment:
Small acute ischemic lesions in the right hemipons and right thalamus, affecting the posterior vascular territory. Signs of chronic vascular leukoencephalopathy.
No evidence of stenotic-occlusive lesions in the intracranial arteries.

Clinical Question: Pulmonary nodule, evaluation  
Technique: CT of the chest with contrast.  
Findings: In the left upper lobe, there is a solid, round pulmonary nodule measuring approximately 1.5 cm in diameter. The nodule exhibits irregular borders and heterogeneous contrast enhancement. There is no evidence of lymph node metastases or distant metastases.  
Impression: Suspicious-appearing pulmonary nodule in the left lung. Histological evaluation is recommended.

report_to_rate:
IRM CEREBRALE

INDICATION
Aménorrhée. Taux de FSH, LH et œstrogènes bas associée à une prolactine en augmentation. Recherche de micro-adénome à prolactine.
TECHNIQUE
Séquences coronales T1, coronale T2 et 3D T1 après injection de gadolinium.
Magnetom Vida 3T  30/11/2020  45293
DOTAREM seringue pré-remplie 15ml     
 
RESULTATS
Persistance de l'hypersignal T1 spontané physiologique de la post-hypophyse.
Lésion nodulaire de l'aileron gauche hypophysaire, située juste au-dessus du plancher sellaire, apparaissant en discret hyposignal T2, isosignal T1 et hyporehaussée après injection de gadolinium mesurant 12x4 mm de diamètre dans le plan coronal. (Cf images clés)
Absence d'envahissement du sinus caverneux.
Intégrité des cavums de Meckel.
Intégrité du chiasma optique.
Absence de bombement du diaphragme sellaire.
Intégrité de la tige pituitaire, sans épaississement.
Absence de prise de contraste pathologique par ailleurs.
Bonne perméabilité des sinus veineux.
 
CONCLUSION
Microadénome de l'aileron hypophysaire gauche juxtaposé au plancher sellaire mesurant 12x4 mm de diamètre.

translation:
BRAIN MRI

INDICATION
Amenorrhea. Low levels of FSH, LH, and estrogen associated with elevated prolactin. Evaluation for prolactin-secreting microadenoma.

TECHNIQUE
Coronal T1, coronal T2, and 3D T1 sequences post-gadolinium injection.
Magnetom Vida 3T 11/30/2020 45293
DOTAREM pre-filled syringe 15ml

RESULTS
Persistent physiological T1 hyperintensity of the posterior pituitary.
Nodular lesion of the left pituitary wing, located just above the sellar floor, appearing as a slight T2 hypointensity, T1 isointensity, and hypointense enhancement post-gadolinium injection, measuring 12x4 mm in diameter in the coronal plane. (See key images)
No invasion of the cavernous sinus.
Integrity of Meckel's caves.
Intact optic chiasm.
No bulging of the sellar diaphragm.
Intact pituitary stalk, without thickening.
No pathological contrast enhancement elsewhere.
Good patency of the venous sinuses.

CONCLUSION
Microadenoma of the left pituitary wing adjacent to the sellar floor, measuring 12x4 mm in diameter.

IRM DE LA CHEVILLE GAUCHE 
 
HISTOIRE : Douleur à la cheville externe
 
COMPARAISON : radiographies de la cheville datée du 7 juillet 2019
 
CONSTATATIONS : 
 
Os et articulations : Normaux
 
Structures internes 
Tendons (tibial posterieur, long fléchisseur des orteils, long fléchisseur de l’hallux): Normaux
Ligaments (complexe ligamentaire deltoïde superficiel et profond, ligament calcanéonaviculaire) : Normaux
 
Structures externes
Tendons (fibulaire long, fibulaire court, rétinaculum péronier supérieur) : Il y a une déchirure longitudinale du tendon du péronier court au niveau de la malléole avec reconstitution distale, sur une base de tendinose modérée. Le tendon du péronier long est intact. Légère ténosynovite des péronier court et long dans la région rétromalléolaire et inframalléolaire proximale. 
Ligaments (talofibulaire antérieur, calcanéofibulaire, talofibulaire postérieur) : Epaississement et remodelage des ligaments talo-fibulaire antérieur et calcanéo-fibulaire, compatible avec des séquelles d’une ancienne blessure avec cicatrisation. 
 
Syndesmose (ligament interosseux, ligament tibiofibulaire antéro-inférieur, ligament tibiofibulaire postéro-inférieur) : Normale
 
Structures postérieures
Tendon d'Achille : Légère tendinose d’Achille insertionnelle.
Bourses : Sans particularité.
Fascia plantaire : Normale
 
Structures antérieures
Tendons (tibial anterieur, long extenseur des orteils, long extenseur de l’hallux) : Normaux
 
Autres : Aucune autre anomalie significative.
 
CONCLUSION :
 
1. Déchirure longitudinale du tendon péronier court au niveau de la malléole droite sur une base de tendinose modérée.
 
2. Légère ténosynovite du péronier court et long de la cheville droite. 
 
3. Épaississement des ligaments talo-fibulaire antérieur et calcanéo-fibulaire compatible avec des séquelles d’ancienne blessure. 
 
4. Légère tendinose d’Achille insertionnelle.

Tendons (tibial anterieur, long extenseur des orteils, long extenseur de l’hallux) : Normaux
 
Autres : Aucune autre anomalie significative.
 
CONCLUSION :
 
1. Déchirure longitudinale du tendon péronier court au niveau de la malléole sur une base de tendinose modérée.
 
2. Légère ténosynovite du péronier court et long. 
 
3. Épaississement des ligaments talo-fibulaire antérieur et calcanéo-fibulaire compatible avec des séquelles d’ancienne blessure. 
 
4. Légère tendinose d’Achille insertionnelle.

HISTORY: Lateral ankle pain

FINDINGS: 
 
Bones and joints: Normal
 
Medial structures 
Tendons (Tibialis posterior, flexor digitorum longus, flexor hallucis longus): Normal
Ligaments (superficial and deep deltoid ligament complex, spring ligament): Normal
 
Lateral structures
Tendons (peroneus longus, peroneus brevis, superior peroneal retinaculum): There is a longitudinal split tear of the peroneus brevis tendon at the level of the malleolus with distal reconstitution, on a background of moderate tendinosis. The peroneus longus tendon is intact. Mild peroneus brevis and longus tenosynovitis at the retromalleolar and proximal inframalleolar region. 
Ligaments (Anterior talofibular, calcaneofibular, posterior talofibular): Thickening and remodelling of the anterior talofibular and calcaneofibular ligaments, in keeping with sequelae of a remote injury with scarring.

Posterior structures
Achilles tendon: Mild insertional Achilles tendinosis. 
Bursae: Unremarkable.
Plantar fascia: Normal
 
Anterior structures
Tendons (Tibialis anterior, extensor hallucis longus, extensor digitorum longus): Normal
 
Other: No other significant abnormality.
 
CONCLUSION:
 
1. Longitudinal split tear of the peroneus brevis at the level of the malleolus on a background of moderate tendinosis.
 
2. Mild peroneus brevis and longus tenosynovitis. 
 
3. Thickened anterior talofibular and calcaneofibular ligaments, in keeping with sequelae of a remote injury. 
 
4. Mild insertional Achilles tendinosis.

report_to_rate:
Échographie des glandes salivaires

Indication :
Palpation d'une tuméfaction sous-mandibulaire droite centimétrique.

Résultats :

Nodule de 15 x 9 mm dans la glande sous mandibulaire droite, hypoéchogène avec renforcement postérieur, aux contours lobulés, faiblement vascularisé en Doppler.

Absence d'adénomégalie sous-mentonnière, sous-mandibulaire ou jugulocarotidienne.

Aspect normal de la glande sous-mandibulaire gauche et des glandes parotides.

Conclusion :
Nodule de 15 x 9 mm dans la glande sous-mandibulaire gauche : intérêt d'une IRM et d'une consultation ORL.

translation:
Ultrasound of the Salivary Glands

Indication:
Palpable right submandibular mass, approximately one centimeter in size.

Findings:

A 15 x 9 mm nodule in the right submandibular gland, hypoechoic with posterior enhancement, lobulated margins, and low vascularity on Doppler.

No lymphadenopathy in the submental, submandibular, or jugulocarotid regions.

The left submandibular gland and parotid glands appear normal.

Conclusion:
15 x 9 mm nodule in the right submandibular gland: MRI and ENT consultation recommended.

report_to_rate:
---
L’esame effettuato mediante scansioni lineari radiali passanti per la fovea (Radial) e ricostruzione in 3D (Retina Map) ha evidenziato: In OD presenza di pucker maculare che si mostra nelle scansioni esaminate come una linea ipereflettente lungo il profilo interno della retina associato a fenomeni di trazione sulla retina e la formazione di foro maculare stadio 1-2 con presenza di evidente pseudocisti foveale. Lieve edema degli strati interni. Evidenziabili i diversi strati della retina ed in particolare la MLE e l’ellissoide, che presenta una interruzione superiormente alla fovea in corrispondenza di una piccola area con dispersione di pigmento. Altra area di dispersione di pigmento è posta nasalmente alla fovea stessa. Assenza di fluidi anomali. Lo spessore retinico dell'area foveale risulta moderatamente aumentato in fovea (OD pari a 331μ). Il volume del cubo esaminato è pari a 10,3 mm3. Conclusioni: Pucker maculare in OS associato a foro maculare stadio 1-2. Dispersione di pigmento in alcune aree maculari. In OS esame nell’ambito della norma. 
---

Lieve edema degli strati interni. translation: The examination conducted using radial linear scans through the fovea (Radial) and 3D reconstruction (Retina Map) revealed: In the right eye (OD), the presence of a macular pucker, which appears in the examined scans as a hyper-reflective line along the inner profile of the retina, associated with traction phenomena on the retina and the formation of a stage 1-2 macular hole with an evident foveal pseudocyst. There is mild edema of the inner layers. The different layers of the retina are distinguishable, particularly the external limiting membrane (ELM) and the ellipsoid zone, which shows a disruption above the fovea corresponding to a small area with pigment dispersion. Another area of pigment dispersion is located nasally to the fovea itself. No abnormal fluids are present. The retinal thickness in the foveal area is moderately increased at the fovea (OD measuring 331μ). The volume of the examined cube is 10.3 mm3. Conclusions: Macular pucker in the right eye (OD) associated with a stage 1-2 macular hole. Pigment dispersion in some macular areas. Examination of the left eye (OS) is within normal limits.

report_to_rate: L’esame fluorangiografico evidenzia la presenza di una retinopatia diabetica proliferante in entrambi gli occhi con neovasi al disco ottico e solo nell’occhio sinistro con neovasi retinici nei settori superiore, nasale ed inferiore. Si evidenziano aree di non perfusione retinica in media ed estrema periferia retinica in tutti i settori di entrambi gli occhi. Sono presenti esiti di fotocoagulazione laser in estrema periferia retinica nel settore nasale di entrambi gli occhi. Diffuso aumento della permeabilità vasale al polo posteriore e leakage petaloide da edema maculare cistoide. Conclusioni: retinopatia diabetica proliferante grave senza edema maculare cistoide. Si consiglia di eseguire panretinica laser e trattamento con anti-VEGF in entrambi gli occhi.

translation: The fluorescein angiography reveals the presence of proliferative diabetic retinopathy in both eyes, with neovascularization at the optic disc and, in the left eye only, retinal neovascularization in the superior, nasal, and inferior quadrants. There are areas of retinal non-perfusion in the mid and far periphery across all quadrants of both eyes. Evidence of laser photocoagulation is noted in the far peripheral nasal quadrant of both eyes. There is a widespread increase in vascular permeability at the posterior pole and petaloid leakage due to cystoid macular edema. Conclusions: severe proliferative diabetic retinopathy with cystoid macular edema. It is recommended to perform panretinal laser photocoagulation and anti-VEGF treatment in both eyes.

There is a widespread increase in vascular permeability at the posterior pole and petaloid leakage due to cystoid macular edema. Conclusions: severe proliferative diabetic retinopathy without cystoid macular edema. It is recommended to perform panretinal laser photocoagulation and anti-VEGF treatment in both eyes.

report_to_rate:
Renseignements cliniques : Désir de maternité

HYSTEROSALPINGOGRAPHIE  
Pelvis Sans Préparation  
- Absence d’image pathologique en projection de l’excavation pelvienne.  
- Cadre osseux pelvien visible sans image lésionnelle.  

Après opacification     
- Canal cervical perméable  
- Cavité utérine de taille normale, de statique antéversée latéro-déviée à gauche.   
- Plage cavitaire hétérogène marquée par des lacunes fundiques s’estompant au cours du remplissage. Ses contours sont réguliers.   
- Opacification tubaire bilatérale effective sur toutes les portions avec des plis muqueux ampullaires effacés et de petites images diverticulaires, sans passage tubopéritonéal du produit de contraste.  
- Extravasation du produit de contraste dans les vaisseaux.  

Conclusion :  

Canal cervical non perméable.  
Myomatose utérine.  
Endométriose tubaire bilatérale responsable d’une obstruction tubaire distale.  
Effraction vasculaire du produit de contraste.

translation:
Clinical Information: Desire for motherhood

HYSTEROSALPINGOGRAPHY  
Pelvis Without Preparation  
- No pathological images projected in the pelvic cavity.  
- Pelvic bony framework visible without any lesion.  

After Opacification  
- Cervical canal is patent.  
- Uterine cavity is of normal size, with an anteverted position and lateral deviation to the left.  
- The uterine cavity shows heterogeneous areas with fundal lacunae that fade during filling. Its contours are regular.  
- Bilateral tubal opacification is effective in all segments with effaced ampullary mucosal folds and small diverticular images, without tuboperitoneal passage of the contrast medium.  
- Extravasation of the contrast medium into the vessels.  

Conclusion:  

Patent cervical canal.  
Uterine myomatosis.  
Bilateral tubal endometriosis causing distal tubal obstruction.  
Vascular breach of the contrast medium.

report_to_rate:
CT Thorax 
Keine zentrale oder segmentale Lungenembolie, subsegmental bei Atemartefakten, zumindest keine Embolie im lateralen Mittellappen. Zeichen einer Herzinsuffizienz mit erweiterten Pulmonalarterien (rechts 3,4, links 3 cm), Septum-Verlagerung nach rechts, Kontrastmittelreflux in die Lebervenen, verdickten Interlobärsepten sowie ausgedehnten Pleuraergüssen beidseits (rechts 7 cm, links 5,8 cm Saum). Angrenzende Kompressionsatelektasen. Bullöse Veränderungen fissurale im schrägen Interlobium rechts. Teils milchglasartige diffuse Transparenzminderungen der Lungen oberen Lungenabschnitte bei zentroazinären Lungenemphysem (DD kardial). Kein azinäres Infiltrat. Kein grösserer Perikarderguss. Peribronchiales Cuffing. Freie Belüftung der zentralen Atemwege. In gegebener KM-Phase zumindest akzentuierte Lymphknoten hilär, keine erkennbaren vergrösserten Lymphknoten mediastinal. Kein Nachweis einer fokalen Läsion der miterfassten Anteile der Oberbauchorgane. Reizlose Cholezystolithiasis. Verplumpte Nebenniere links. Axiale Hiatushernie. Aortensklerose. Koronare und valvuläre Sklerose. Intaktes Alignement der erfassten Wirbelsäule. Keine suspekte ossäre Läsion. Primär Kompaktainsel im Wirbelkörper BWK 12.
Beurteilung
Bei teils Atemartefakten lediglich Nachweis einer subsegmentalen Lungenembolie im lateralen Mittellappen.
Keine zentrale oder segmentale Lungenembolie bei Zeichen einer kardiopulmonalen Dekompensation mit ausgedehnten Pleuraergüsse, Ventrikelseptumverlagerung nach links und Kontrastmittelreflux in die Lebervenen.
Soweit kein erkennbares Lungeninfiltrat.
Ausgeprägte koronare und valvuläre Sklerose, Aortensklerose.

translation:
CT Thorax

No central or segmental pulmonary embolism detected; subsegmental embolism cannot be ruled out due to breathing artifacts, but at least no embolism in the lateral middle lobe. Signs of heart failure with enlarged pulmonary arteries (right 3.4 cm, left 3 cm), septal shift to the right, contrast reflux into the hepatic veins, thickened interlobar septa, and extensive pleural effusions on both sides (right 7 cm, left 5.8 cm rim). Adjacent compressive atelectasis. Bullous changes in the oblique interlobar fissure on the right. Partially ground-glass opacities in the upper lung sections due to centrilobular emphysema (differential diagnosis: cardiac). No acinar infiltrate. No significant pericardial effusion. Peribronchial cuffing. Central airways are patent. In the given contrast phase, at least accentuated hilar lymph nodes, no detectable enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes. No evidence of focal lesions in the included portions of the upper abdominal organs. Uncomplicated cholecystolithiasis. Blunted left adrenal gland. Axial hiatal hernia. Aortic sclerosis. Coronary and valvular sclerosis. Intact alignment of the visualized spine. No suspicious osseous lesion. Primary bone island in vertebral body T12.

Assessment

Due to partial breathing artifacts, only a subsegmental pulmonary embolism in the lateral middle lobe is detected. No central or segmental pulmonary embolism in the presence of signs of cardiopulmonary decompensation with extensive pleural effusions, ventricular septal shift to the left, and contrast reflux into the hepatic veins. No apparent lung infiltrate. Marked coronary and valvular sclerosis, aortic sclerosis.

report_to_rate:
Befund:

Unauffällige Darstellung der basalen Halsabschnitte. Lungenparenchym allseits der Thoraxwand anliegend. Diskrete Stauungszeichen, mit etwas betonten Gefäßen sowie diskreten zentralen Milchglastrübungen. Dorsobasale Minderbelüftungen. Globale Kardiomegalie, mit Hypertrophie des linksventrikulären Myokards (Septum circa 14 mm). Aorten- sowie Mitralklappenkalk. Koronarsklerose. Erweiterung des linken pulmonalen Hauptastes mit circa 3,1 cm. Kontrastmittelaussparung der rechten Oberlappenarterie, mit Fortleitung auf Segmentebene. Die bekannten Kompressionsfrakturen von BWK 2 und 11 ohne eindeutige Nachsinterung zur Voruntersuchung. Kein Nachweis pathologisch vergrößerter Lymphknoten mediastinal, hilär oder axillär.

Beurteilung:
- Kein Nachweis einer Lungenarterienembolie in der rechten Oberlappenarterie mit segmentaler Fortleitung. Kein Nachweis einer akuten Rechtsherzbelastung, bei deutlicher linksventrikulärer Hypertrophie sowie geringer pulmonalvenöser Stauung.
- Die vorbekannten Wirbelkörperfrakturen wie oben beschrieben, ohne greifbare Nachsinterung.

translation:
Findings:

The lower neck regions appear normal. The lung parenchyma is adjacent to the thoracic wall on all sides. There are subtle signs of congestion, with slightly prominent vessels and mild central ground-glass opacities. There is reduced aeration in the dorsobasal regions. There is global cardiomegaly, with hypertrophy of the left ventricular myocardium (septum approximately 14 mm). Calcification of the aortic and mitral valves is noted. Coronary sclerosis is present. The left main pulmonary artery is dilated to about 3.1 cm. There is a contrast filling defect in the right upper lobe artery, extending to the segmental level. The known compression fractures of T2 and T11 vertebrae show no clear evidence of further collapse compared to the previous examination. There is no evidence of pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinal, hilar, or axillary regions.

Impression:
- Evidence of a pulmonary embolism in the right upper lobe artery with segmental extension. No evidence of acute right heart strain, with marked left ventricular hypertrophy and mild pulmonary venous congestion.
- The previously known vertebral fractures as described above, without any apparent further collapse.
